cont.entity_b: Except for drawers due to shallow tap holes.

cont.entity_a: Quality seems good with solid, heavy wood. Pre-drilled screw holes lined up nicely.
cont.entity_b: Better quality than IKEA. Extremely solid piece of furniture. Heavy and sturdy with a granite top.

cont.entity_a: Attractive design with beautiful solid wood.
cont.entity_b: Fits well in the kitchen. White color is slightly ivory.
Packaged extremely well with all pieces in perfect condition.

cont.entity_a: Suitable for storing an induction cooker and cookware.
cont.entity_b: Functional with good storage and drawer space.

cont.entity_a: Rolls easily with lockable wheels. Wheels are not ideal for the cart's design.
Vendor provided efficient customer service for replacement parts.
Sturdy construction but caster installation issues.
cont.entity_b: Sturdy with a risk of being front-heavy.

cont.entity_a: Suggest not fully tightening screws until setup is complete.

cont.entity_b: Priced at $450, considered good value. Price fluctuates, with a noted $35 drop after purchase.

cont.entity_a: Can hold a medium-sized microwave. Optional knife holder.
cont.entity_b: Granite top enhances the cart's appearance. Drawers slide easily.

cont.entity_a: Quality seems good with solid, heavy wood.
cont.entity_b: Solid oak construction with a granite top.
Granite top is a plus. Granite countertop is heavy and requires careful handling. Granite top missing in one purchase.

cont.entity_a: Missing hole fill knobs and required superglue for wheel holder crack. Pre-drilled holes for assembly are slightly too large, risking screw stripping.
cont.entity_b: Some wood pieces arrived cracked. Chemical smell in drawers that dissipates over time.
